pullRequest.body:
Prove the polynomial FLT, using Mason-Stothers theorem #15706. More generally, prove non-solvability of Fermat-Catalan equation: $ux^p + vx^q + wz^r = 0$ where $u, v, w \in k^\times$ are units and $p, q, r \ge 3$ with $pq + qr + rp \le pqr$.

Also derive the `IsCoprime b c` and `IsCoprime c a` assumptions from the `IsCoprime a b` and `a + b + c = 0` ones in  `Polynomial.abc`.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [x] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->
- [x] depends on:  #19048
- [x] depends on: #19133
- [x] depends on: #19875
- [ ] depends on: #20143 


[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
@jcpaik Could you help me to remove `sorry`s? Also, `flt_catalan_aux` haven't fixed yet.

> @jcpaik Could you help me to remove `sorry`s? Also, `flt_catalan_aux` haven't fixed yet.

Merge the PRs then the file is sorry-free and proves polynomial FLT. We only then need to golf/separate the file into smaller pieces.
@YaelDillies Could you review this?
Sorry, I really don't have time right now 😦 Please ask again in ten days if it hasn't moved

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#19048~~
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#19133~~
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#19875~~
* leanprover-community/mathlib4#20143
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (🤖). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->
Thank you for the PR! Very nice result

@jcpaik Currently this line gives following errors: do you have any guess?
```
Messages (2)
Polynomial.lean:300:9
failed to synthesize
  GCDMonoid k[X]
Additional diagnostic information may be available using the `set_option diagnostics true` command.
Polynomial.lean:300:31
rcases tactic failed: x✝ : ?m.87687 is not an inductive datatype
```

Maybe try importing `Mathlib.RingTheory.EuclideanDomain`? Or `Mathlib.RingTheory.Polynomial.Content`? The code needs a "GCDMonoid instance", so I searched it at leansearch.net
The latter path has a NormalizedGCDMonoid instance

@jcpaik It seems that if we replace `u ≠ 0` into `IsUnit u` for auxiliary lemmas (not main theorems) then proofs could be a bit simpler (for main theorems, keep as nonzero assumption and use `isUnit_C` for example). How do you think? At least for this `isCoprime_mul_units_left`, I'll use the unit version PR.
Agreed!

I found that some part of the proofs use both of $u \ne 0$ and $u$ being a unit (to be precise, `C u` being nonzero or unit), so replacing this does not make proofs significantly shorter, so I only modified a few. (`Ne.isUnit_C` is useful enough)

```suggestion
theorem radical_of_isUnit {a : M} (h : IsUnit a) : radical a = 1 :=
```

```suggestion
theorem radical_mul_of_isUnit_left {a u : M} (h : IsUnit u) : radical (u * a) = radical a :=
```

```suggestion
theorem radical_mul_of_isUnit_right {a u : M} (h : IsUnit u) : radical (a * u) = radical a :=
```
Could you make this into a separate PR please?
Here it is! #19875

```suggestion
variable {k R : Type*} [Field k] [CommRing R] [IsDomain R] [NormalizationMonoid R]
```

```suggestion
  have hsum' : b + c + a = 0 := by rwa [add_rotate] at hsum
```
Why not avoid the `;`?

```suggestion
More generally, we can prove non-solvability of the Fermat-Catalan equation: there are no
```

```suggestion
The proof uses the Mason-Stothers theorem (Polynomial ABC theorem) and infinite descent
```

```suggestion
(in the characteristic p case).
```

```suggestion
      gcongr
```

```suggestion
    _ ≤ _ := by gcongr
```
I think the philosophy is "better a high-powered tactic than having to remember names of random lemmas"
This feels like it could be useful more generally -- why make it private? And do you think `(n : k) \ne 0` is more idiomatic than what you have?

Maybe put under [Mathlib.Algebra.Polynomial.Derivative](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/master/Mathlib/Algebra/Polynomial/Derivative.lean)? Also, I have no idea which one is more idiomatic honestly.

Again I'm surprised that this is private and in this file. In fact I'm quite surprised we don't already have it. @YaelDillies points out that we have `smul_eq_zero_iff_left` so it should probably be called `mul_eq_zero_iff_left`.

I wasn't sure which of the `private lemma`s here needs to go to mathlib or stay here, but as you said maybe most of them would. This was definitely one of them to be, but also a thing that I couldn't find where to put.

Yeah, this proof makes me think that the clunky-looking hypothesis `chn : ¬ringChar k ∣ n` should be replaced with `chn : (n : k) \ne 0` (which is what you actually use). What do you think? There are a couple more occurrences of `¬ringChar x ∣ y` in mathlib but not that many. Do you think my suggestion is more or less readable? You have 12 occurrences of this idiom in this file, which is more than occurs in all of the rest of mathlib.
I see, then I'll replace those 👍
Why make this private and put it here? Why not make it public and put it in the right place with the rest of the `expand` API? That would be better for the library.
Made this and `is_coprime_of_expand` as another PR #20143
Same comment for this.
I think `generalize eq_d : a.natDegree = d` is the idiomatic way to do this (but then `eq_d` is the other way around so you have to `rw [\l eq_d]` in a couple of cases where you had `rw [eq_d]`)

This isn't idiomatic. Firstly I think `induction'` is now discouraged and one should use Lean 4's `induction`. Secondly `induction ... generalizing` is supposed to be used instead of the `revert...intros` hack.
@seewoo5 Can I handle this?

```suggestion
      obtain ⟨ad, bd, cd⟩ := flt_catalan_deriv
        hp hq hr hineq chp chq chr ha hb hc hab hu hv hw heq
```
I think `obtain` is nicer than `rcases` because `obtain` is an English word and `rcases` isn't.

```suggestion
        rwa [← eq_a, ← eq_b]
```

```suggestion
        rwa [Polynomial.expand_eq_zero (zero_lt_iff.mpr chn0)] at heq
```

```suggestion
    rwa [add_rotate] at heq
```

```suggestion
  rw [← sub_eq_zero, ← one_mul (a ^ n), ← one_mul (b ^ n), ← one_mul (c ^ n), sub_eq_add_neg,
    ← neg_mul] at heq
```
Probably best to keep the arrow on the same line

```suggestion
  have eq_lhs : n * n + n * n + n * n = 3 * n * n := by ring
```

```suggestion
  rw [eq_lhs, mul_assoc, mul_assoc]
```

```suggestion
  exact Nat.mul_le_mul_right (n * n) hn
```
I don't like semicolons :-) I think the style is "different tactics on different lines" but here you don't need two tactics.
I would say "different tactics on different lines unless your tactic block would be a one-liner otherwise"

```suggestion
    have hdncn : d ^ n ∣ c ^ n := ⟨_, heq.symm⟩
```

pullRequest.title: feat: Polynomial FLT
